headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Meta, Microsoft, Alphabet, FMC, C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Roblox, Metsera, Chipotle, and More
summary: Shares of companies in the tech sector led the decline in the wake of quarterly earnings from Meta Platforms and Microsoft.  Meta Platforms  missed analysts’ third-quarter earnings expectations and the stock declined 11%.  Meta said the earnings miss included a one-time tax charge of $15.93 billion from the implementation of the Trump administration’s One Big Beautiful Bill Act.

headline: Chipotle shares plunge as investors chew on tariffs, weak spending
summary:
STORY: Shares of Chipotle Mexican Grill plunged as much as 22% Thursday morning to a more than 2-year low after it cut its sales forecast for the third time this year.

The move fanned concerns around how the fast-casual chain is navigating tariffs, inflation and tighter spending by U.S. consumers.

Consumer sentiment has remained stubbornly weak in recent months even though high-income consumers continue to prop up overall spending in the United States. 

Other companies across the retail spectrum have flagged how shoppers have been trading down from brand names to private labels or shifting to more affordable options like Walmart.

Still, Chipotle's results caught investors by surprise, and analysts said its cost pressures could persist.

Chipotle executives also pointed to a sharp pullback from U.S. households earning less than $100,000 a year, a group that accounts for about 40% of its sales and which the company categorizes as low- to middle-income.

Its customers aged 25-35 years are also under pressure from rising unemployment, resumed student loan payments and sluggish wage growth.

content.title: Chipotle shares plunge as investors chew on tariffs, weak spending
content.summary:
STORY: Shares of Chipotle Mexican Grill plunged as much as 22% Thursday morning to a more than 2-year low after it cut its sales forecast for the third time this year.

The move fanned concerns around how the fast-casual chain is navigating tariffs, inflation and tighter spending by U.S. consumers.

Consumer sentiment has remained stubbornly weak in recent months even though high-income consumers continue to prop up overall spending in the United States. 

Other companies across the retail spectrum have flagged how shoppers have been trading down from brand names to private labels or shifting to more affordable options like Walmart.

Still, Chipotle's results caught investors by surprise, and analysts said its cost pressures could persist.

Chipotle executives also pointed to a sharp pullback from U.S. households earning less than $100,000 a year, a group that accounts for about 40% of its sales and which the company categorizes as low- to middle-income.

Its customers aged 25-35 years are also under pressure from rising unemployment, resumed student loan payments and sluggish wage growth.

headline: Chipotle drags fast casual stocks lower, Meta reports raising $125B

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Lunch Bowl Slowdown Hits Cava, Sweetgreen Shares
summary: Shares of Sweetgreen and Cava declined after Chipotle Mexican Grill warned of lower demand from younger and low-income consumers, a key demographic for fast-casual restaurants.  Sweetgreen slid 6% on Thursday, bringing its year-to-date fall to 80%.  Cava fell 8%, with shares now down 51% this year.

headline: Starbucks sales grow, Chipotle's consumer woes: Earnings takeaways
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) stock continues to sink lower in Thursday's session after its third quarter revenue fell just short of estimates, it cut its full-year guidance again, and the company noted pull backs in low to middle-income consumers. Meanwhile, Starbucks (SBUX) stock appears unfazed as the coffee giant published global same-store sales growth amid CEO Brian Niccol's turnaround plan. Yahoo Finance senior consumer reporter Brooke DiPalma highlights the biggest takeaways and stock moves from the two companies' latest earnings reports. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Chipotle stock dives on consumer woes. Why Starbucks was unfazed.
summary: Chipotle (CMG) stock tumbles after CEO Scott Boatwright reported that middle to low-income consumers are dining out less frequently due to worries about the economy, with 25 to 35-year-old customers being especially challenged. Despite the burrito maker citing macroeconomic concerns, Starbucks (SBUX) — which also released earnings — didn't say it is facing the same consumer spending changes. Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma outlines the details, as Crossmark Global Investments chief market strategist Victoria Fernandez examines why Starbucks didn't echo Chipotle's consumer spending challenges. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.description:
Chipotle (CMG) stock tumbles after CEO Scott Boatwright reported that middle to low-income consumers are dining out less frequently due to worries about the economy, with 25 to 35-year-old customers being especially challenged.

Despite the burrito maker citing macroeconomic concerns, Starbucks (SBUX) — which also released earnings — didn't say it is facing the same consumer spending changes.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma outlines the details, as Crossmark Global Investments chief market strategist Victoria Fernandez examines why Starbucks didn't echo Chipotle's consumer spending challenges.

headline: Chipotle Stock Plunges on Forecast Cut, Downbeat Sentiment on Consumers
summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill shares plunged Thursday after the company reduced its outlook for the year and warned that core customers are sharply paring back visits.  The company said while there was a broad pullback across all income levels, executives homed in on younger consumers as being a particular challenge.  “We’re losing them to grocery and food at home,” Chipotle Chief Executive Scott Boatwright said.

content.title: Chipotle Stock Plunges on Forecast Cut, Downbeat Sentiment on Consumers
content.summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill shares plunged Thursday after the company reduced its outlook for the year and warned that core customers are sharply paring back visits.  The company said while there was a broad pullback across all income levels, executives homed in on younger consumers as being a particular challenge.  “We’re losing them to grocery and food at home,” Chipotle Chief Executive Scott Boatwright said.

headline: Google vs. Meta, Boeing-Airbus, Chipotle: Trending Stocks
summary: Why did Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) soar while Meta (META) plummeted in premarket, in the wake of respective earnings reports? In aviation, the divide between Boeing (BA) and Airbus (AIR.PA) deepens, with the American plane maker's stock sliding - while its European rival rallies. Chipotle (CMG) tanks nearly 19% in premarket, along with other restaurant chains (CAVA, WING, SHAK) also in the red. In semiconductors, Samsung (005930.KS) and Nvidia (NVDA) are trending. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.
